ifm_schema.description: Common interface management. It includes the public configuration of interfaces.

statistic-interval.description: Set the interval at which global flow statistics are collected.

ipv4-ignore-primary-sub.description: Enable/disable the function of ignoring primary/secondary of IPv4 address type. All secondary addresses must be deleted before this function is enabled.

sub-interface-link-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on all Sub-interface.

damp.description: Enable/disable suppression on interfaces' physical status flappings.

tx-off.description: Enable/disable interfaces from sending signals if the interfaces' physical status flappings are suppressed.

auto-recovery-times.description: List of automatic recovery time configuration.

time-value.description: Delay for the status transition from down to up.

interfaces.description: List of configuring information on an interface.

interface.description: Configure information on an interface. Physical, NULL, Virtual-if, and Virtual-Template0 interfaces cannot be created or deleted.

name.description: The textual name of the interface. It should be the name of the interface as assigned by the local device. It should be suitable for use in commands which entered at the device's 'console'. This might be a text name, such as 'NULL0', depending on the interface naming syntax of the device.

class.description: Identify a main interface or a sub-interface.

type.description: Type of an interface. Interfaces include physical and logical interfaces.

parent-name.description: Name of the main interface. For example, Ethernet0/1/0.

number.description: Number of an interface. For example,1, 0/1/0, or 2:1.

admin-status.description: Administrative status of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-protocol.description: Link protocol. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

router-type.description: Route attribute of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

clear-ip-df.description: Enable/disable a device to forcibly fragment IP packets on an outbound interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-up-down-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable the statistics function on an interface. The default value of this node varies according to different interface types. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-mode.description: Mode of statistics collection. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

bandwidth-type.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

bandwidth-mbps.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

bandwidth.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

bandwidth-kbps.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

mtu.description:
Maximum transmission unit of an interface.

spread-mtu-flag.description: Enable/disable the function of spreading the MTU value of main interface to subinterface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-interval.description: Interval at which flow statistics are collected on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

vrf-name.description: Name of a VPN instance. It uniquely identifies a VPN instance. The VRF name of the DCN interface cannot be created, modified, or deleted.

l2-mode-enable.description: Enable/disable the function of creating an L2 Sub-interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

mac-address.description: Config MAC Address. Constraints on MAC address configuration varies according to interfaces. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

position.description: Position of an interface. For example, 0/1/0. Data can be queried only on physical interfaces.

is-l2-switch.description: To identify a layer2 switch port.

vs-name.description: Name of a VS to which an interface belongs.

l2-switch-port-index.description: L2 switch port index of an interface.

protocol-up-delay-time.description: Specify the protocol up-delay-time value in seconds.

control-flap.description: Enable/disable flapping control on an interface.

suppress.description: Suppression threshold on an interface. The value must be greater than the reusing threshold and smaller than the suppression upper limit.

reuse.description: Reusing threshold of an interface. The value must be smaller than the suppression threshold.

ceiling.description: Maximum suppression value on an interface. The value should be greater than the damping suppression threshold.

decay-ok.description: The penalty value of an Up interface attenuates to 1/2.

decay-ng.description: The penalty value of a Down interface attenuates to 1/2.

mode.description: Include single and multiple modes. The mode cannot be modified after being referenced.

pwtag.description: Configure the P-Tag of the packets in the PW with VLAN.

tag.description: Tag type, include local switching, rt-protocol and none type, this value can not be merged.

user-mode.description: Enable or disable the user mode.

macsec.description: Configure MACsec application. Before applying the macsec configuration, you need to activate the macsec port license and apply for sufficient license resources.

ckn-caks.description: Configure secure connectivity association name and key. The range supported by this node varies according to the interface type.

ckn-cak.description: Enable/disable secure connectivity association name and key.

ckn.description: The value of ckn; CKN is an even number in hexadecimal notation, containing at least one digit and one letter. The letters are case-insensitive.

cak.description: The value of cak; CAK is a hexadecimal notation. The letters are case-insensitive. It must be different from CKN. The length of CAK can only be 32 bits, but in the case of encryption mode, the query result will be more than 100 bits, so the length range is defined as 1 to 160.

confidentiality-offsets.description: Configure confidentiality offset. The range supported by this node varies according to the interface type.

replay-windows.description: Configure replay protection window size. The range supported by this node varies according to the interface type.

name.description: The textual name of the interface. It should be the name of the interface as assigned by the local device. mka-status1.description: Status of an MKA session in protocol negotiation.

member-identifier1.description: Identifier of a member in MKA.

key-server1.description: Whether the local device is the key server.

principal-actor1.description: Whether the connection is a major connection and whether the CKN is being used.

latest-sak-status1.description: Enabling status in SAK sending and receiving directions. During SAK switching, the SAK installed on the key server enables packet sending and then packet receiving. Packet sending and packet receiving of the non-key server are enabled at the same time. When packet sending and receiving are enabled at the same time for the SAKs on both ends, use this SAK to encrypt and decrypt data packets.

latest-sak-association1.description: When a key server is distributing different SAKs, SAK association numbers are cyclically allocated in order. During encryption transmission, the SCI is used together to distinguish different SAKs.

latest-sak-key-identifier1.description: Latest SAK key identifier, which uniquely identifies a SAK.

latest-sak-key-number1.description: Latest SAK key number that is allocated by the key server and is a part of the SAK identifier.

old-sak-status1.description: Enabling status in SAK sending and receiving directions. During SAK switching, when the new SAK takes effect, the status of the original SAK is changed to N/A. The original SAK becomes invalid.

old-sak-association1.description: Previous SAK key identifier, which uniquely identifies a SAK.

old-sak-key-identifier1.description: Previous SAK identifier, which uniquely identifies a SAK.

old-sak-key-number1.description: Previous SAK number which is allocated by the key server and is a part of the SAK identifier.

transmit-short-sci1.description: Identifier of SCI in the short format, which uniquely identifies a security channel in the system.

lpl-member-identifier1.description: Identifier of a learned peer member.

lpl-message-sequence-number1.description: Message number of a learned peer member.

lpl-priority1.description: Key server priority of a learned peer member.

lpl-capability1.description: Capability value of a learned peer member.

lpl-receive-sci1.description: SCI value of a learned member interface.

lpl-short-sci1.description: SSCI value of a learned peer member.

ppl-member-identifier1.description: Identifier of a peer member under negotiation.

ppl-message-sequence-number1.description: Message number of a peer member under negotiation.

ppl-priority1.description: Key server priority of a peer member under negotiation.

ppl-capability1.description: Capability value of a peer member under negotiation.

ppl-receive-sci1.description: SCI value of a peer member under negotiation.

ppl-short-sci1.description: SSCI value of a peer member under negotiation.

mka-transmit-interval.description: Interval at which MKA protocol packets are sent.

mka-life-time.description: MKA session timeout duration. When MKA packets are not received within the specified period, the protocol is re-negotiated.

sak-life-time.description: SAK session timeout duration. To ensure data packet security, when a SAK has been used for too long, replace the SAK.

capability.description: Information about the MACsec functions that can be provided, including integrity check, encryption, and encryption offset.

mode.description: Whether to encrypt data when integrity check is supported in MACsec encryption mode.

frame-validation.description: Mode of processing MACsec packet verification failures.

replay-protection.description: Whether MACsec replay protection is enabled.

replay-window.description: The replay protection allows packet reordering. The reordered packets can be accepted within the replay protection window, and the packets beyond the window are dropped.

confidentiality-offset.description: From which byte behind the MACsec tag a frame is encrypted. Some applications (such as load balancing) that need to identify IPv4/IPv6 packet headers require that the packet header cannot be encrypted. In this case, configure encryption offset.

include-sci.description: Whether MACsec data packets carry the SCI. The SCI uniquely identifies a security channel in the system.

mka-cipher-suite.description: MKA encryption suite that uniquely identifies the SAK encryption algorithm for the key server.

macsec-cipher-suite.description: MACsec encryption suite that uniquely identifies the SAK encryption algorithm for the key server.

transmit-sci.description: Local SCI value. The SCI uniquely identifies a security channel in the system.

wrong-ckn-num.description: Number of packets that fail in CKN verification.

wrong-icv-num.description: Number of packets that fail in ICV verification.

sak-install-times.description: Number of times the SAK is installed.

sak-delete-times.description: Number of times the SAK is deleted.

sak-swap-times.description: Number of times the SAK is switched.

latest-sak-reason.description: Cause of the latest SAK switching.

pe-vlan.description: VLAN ID in the outer VLAN tag.

ce-vlan.description: VLAN ID in the inner VLAN tag.

ckn-caks_schema.description: Configure secure connectivity association name and key. The range supported by this node varies according to the interface type.

ckn-cak.description: Enable/disable secure connectivity association name and key.

ckn.description: The value of ckn; CKN is an even number in hexadecimal notation, containing at least one digit and one letter. The letters are case-insensitive.

cak.description: The value of cak; CAK is a hexadecimal notation. The letters are case-insensitive. It must be different from CKN. The length of CAK can only be 32 bits, but in the case of encryption mode, the query result will be more than 100 bits, so the length range is defined as 1 to 160.

vlan-in-clear.description: Enable/disable VLAN tag configured to bypass MACsec encryption.

latest-sak-key-number2.description: Latest SAK key number that is allocated by the key server and is a part of the SAK identifier.

old-sak-status2.description: Enabling status in SAK sending and receiving directions. During SAK switching, when the new SAK takes effect, the status of the original SAK is changed to N/A. The original SAK becomes invalid.

old-sak-association2.description: Previous SAK key identifier, which uniquely identifies a SAK.

old-sak-key-identifier2.description: Previous SAK identifier, which uniquely identifies a SAK.

old-sak-key-number2.description: Previous SAK number which is allocated by the key server and is a part of the SAK identifier.

transmit-short-sci2.description: Identifier of SCI in the short format, which uniquely identifies a security channel in the system.

lpl-member-identifier2.description: Identifier of a learned peer member.

lpl-message-sequence-number2.description: Message number of a learned peer member.

lpl-priority2.description: Key server priority of a learned peer member.

lpl-capability2.description: Capability value of a learned peer member.

lpl-receive-sci2.description: SCI value of a learned member interface.

lpl-short-sci2.description: SSCI value of a learned peer member.

ppl-member-identifier2.description: Identifier of a peer member under negotiation.

ppl-message-sequence-number2.description: Message number of a peer member under negotiation.

ppl-priority2.description: Key server priority of a peer member under negotiation.

ppl-capability2.description: Capability value of a peer member under negotiation.

ppl-receive-sci2.description: SCI value of a peer member under negotiation.

ppl-short-sci2.description: SSCI value of a peer member under negotiation.

mka-transmit-interval.description: Interval at which MKA protocol packets are sent.

mka-life-time.description: MKA session timeout duration. When MKA packets are not received within the specified period, the protocol is re-negotiated.

sak-life-time.description: SAK session timeout duration. To ensure data packet security, when a SAK has been used for too long, replace the SAK.

capability.description: Information about the MACsec functions that can be provided, including integrity check, encryption, and encryption offset.

mode.description: Whether to encrypt data when integrity check is supported in MACsec encryption mode.

frame-validation.description: Mode of processing MACsec packet verification failures.

replay-protection.description: Whether MACsec replay protection is enabled.

replay-window.description: The replay protection allows packet reordering. The reordered packets can be accepted within the replay protection window, and the packets beyond the window are dropped.

confidentiality-offset.description: From which byte behind the MACsec tag a frame is encrypted. Some applications (such as load balancing) that need to identify IPv4/IPv6 packet headers require that the packet header cannot be encrypted. In this case, configure encryption offset.

include-sci.description: Whether MACsec data packets carry the SCI. The SCI uniquely identifies a security channel in the system.

mka-cipher-suite.description: MKA encryption suite that uniquely identifies the SAK encryption algorithm for the key server.

macsec-cipher-suite.description: MACsec encryption suite that uniquely identifies the SAK encryption algorithm for the key server.

transmit-sci.description: Local SCI value. The SCI uniquely identifies a security channel in the system.

wrong-ckn-num.description: Number of packets that fail in CKN verification.

wrong-icv-num.description: Number of packets that fail in ICV verification.

sak-install-times.description: Number of times the SAK is installed.

sak-delete-times.description: Number of times the SAK is deleted.

sak-swap-times.description: Number of times the SAK is switched.

latest-sak-reason.description: Cause of the latest SAK switching.

pe-vlan.description: VLAN ID in the outer VLAN tag.

ce-vlan.description: VLAN ID in the inner VLAN tag.

interface-macsecs_schema.description: List of MACsec data packet statistics.

valid-packets.description: Number of packets protected by MACsec.

input-protected-bytes.description: Number of bytes for input which only integrity check is implemented but encryption is not.

decrypted-bytes.description: Number of bytes for which both integrity check and encryption are implemented.

late-packets.description: Number of packets that fail the replay window size check.

not-valid-packets.description: Number of packets that fail the integrity check or encounter decryption errors.

badtag-packets.description: Number of packets with incorrect ICV length or invalid sectag header.

no-using-sa-packets.description: Number of packets with SAs obtained from received sectag being unavailable.

protected-packets.description: Number of packets for which only ICV is encapsulated.

encrypted-packets.description: Number of packets for which ICV is encapsulated and encryption is implemented.

encrypted-bytes.description: Number of bytes for which ICV is encapsulated and encryption is implemented.

valid-packets.description: Number of packets protected by MACsec.

input-protected-bytes.description: Number of bytes for input which only integrity check is implemented but encryption is not.

decrypted-bytes.description: Number of bytes for which both integrity check and encryption are implemented.

mka-status1.description: Status of an MKA session in protocol negotiation.

member-identifier1.description: Identifier of a member in MKA.

key-server1.description: Whether the local device is the key server.

principal-actor1.description: Whether the connection is a major connection and whether the CKN is being used.

latest-sak-status1.description: Enabling status in SAK sending and receiving directions. During SAK switching, the SAK installed on the key server enables packet sending and then packet receiving. Packet sending and packet receiving of the non-key server are enabled at the same time. When packet sending and receiving are enabled at the same time for the SAKs on both ends, use this SAK to encrypt and decrypt data packets.
